meanings.definition: In a manner that suggests blame or fault.
meanings.sent1: She looked at him accusingly when the vase broke.
meanings.sent2: He pointed accusingly at the spilled milk on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed accusingly at the empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathered accusingly in the sky before the storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's eyes bore accusingly into the student who was talking during the lesson.

meanings.definition: In a way that implies guilt or wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: He shook his head accusingly at his friend who ate the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The detective stared accusingly at the suspect during the interrogation.
meanings.sent3: The mirror reflected accusingly at her when she tried on the dress that was too small.
meanings.sent4: The old house creaked accusingly in the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The judge's gaze fell accusingly on the defendant as the verdict was read.
